website_summaries.verdict: Fizik revamps its R5 road model to provide versatility and a better fit. The result is the Tempo Overcurve R5, which puts its effortless style, comfort, high adjustability, and the Overcurve construction in the spotlight.It performs well on all types of roads, while its form-fitting build offers all-day comfort. The shoe is recommended to riders who prefer soles with mid-range stiffness.
pros: A majority of cyclists say that the Fizik Tempo Overcurve R5 feels comfortable
Numerous testers appreciate the shoe’s highly adjustable closure
Several purchasers mention how the pair’s sleek design looks stylish and high-end
The Tempo Overcurve R5 cycling shoe has excellent quality, according to a bunch of reviewers
Based on some buyers, this model has good value for money
It is lightweight, say a number of wearers
cons: Some riders expected more rigidity from this shoe’s soles
A few users claim that positioning the cleats could be tricky because markings aren’t as visible
The pair’s tongue could use more padding, according to a couple of wearers

customer_reviews.title: These do not pinch my toes like some others
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet. These do not pinch my toes like some others.
customer_reviews.author: L F

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but durable?
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are fantastic overall -- their weight, slick design, and fit. The reason for only three stars is that after 2 months of use (riding 2-3 times per week for 1-2 hours), the front of the shoes' shape has narrowed (or caved in). Small and sharp creases have formed inside which pinch the toes. Having bought these as a snug fit, this pinching now requires two socks to protectively cushion the toes. I've contacted fizik in hopes that this pair's defect is singular and could possibly be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: IB

customer_reviews.title: True to size, boa system is on point.
customer_reviews.text: These things have taken a few rides totalling over 100 miles so far. Positives: Design and overall look Quality construction Boa system - way better than Velcro or laces. This is the biggest selling point for me. Adequate ventilation Cons: I have narrow feet and these are great. If I had wide feet I think these would not feel good. Also the Velcro strap near the toe does nothing for security. The soles of my feet get sore after about 25 miles but perhaps an insole would solve that problem. Overall glad I purchased. These were my first road biking cleats after using tennis shoes for a few years.
customer_reviews.author: MCJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes but be careful when tightening the cleat
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful shoes and I Love them BUT the second time I wore them I had to adjust the cleat and when I went to re-tighten the cleat, there was a “pop” and one of the three screws won’t tighten. Due to the weather I couldn’t ride in them earlier and of course, this happened 2 days after I could return them so I have had to put in a warranty claim with the manufacturer. I haven’t had this happen before with any other road shoes so i’m Hoping this is a freak ocurance.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly R.

customer_reviews.title: Being a weekend warrior I wanted good quality that didn't break the bank
customer_reviews.text: After doing a lot of research I finally decided to go with the Fizik R5 UOMO. Being a weekend warrior I wanted good quality that didn't break the bank. Compared to my previous cycling shoes, these are super light weight, comfortable, and sleek! I like the measurement marks on the sole. Helps when making adjustments. The cable strap is easy to use when tightening and loosening. My only compliant would be the width of the shoe is a bit tight. It isn't a problem when riding for a few hours, but I can see a problem for anything more than that. Overall it is a great road bike shoe for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Mark O

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Once you've dialed-in what your shoe size actually is, you'll be hard-pressed to wear anything else. I had to go a few rounds with this because the sizing did NOT match that of my Giro's (I wear a 45 with Giro, but a 44 with these) but the Fiziks are evidently engineered to be a glove-fit. I tried the 43.5 and they fit TOO well - literally such a close fit that I couldn’t wear socks. But, now that I found the right fit, my Giro Savix have found themselves having to compete heavily for ride time lol; which may get worse once I nab the fiziks in black :). All in all, good buy.
customer_reviews.author: vond

customer_reviews.title: Really good product for newbies
customer_reviews.text: Dont know much about this type of shoes so this purchase was kind of a gamble, didnt even know the brand. I always just heard from SHIMANO. I tried to stay withing mid range price to ballpark in quality and this shoes are great. The laces system is amazing and easy. It comes with the cleats, i installed them myself, is easy. the adjustment will depend on each person. So far i just put them however and they work, only a little numbness in my left toe, i guess the float in this grey cleats lets me compensate any miss alignment. Anyways, really recommended .
customer_reviews.author: Ferfranchina

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, light and rigid
customer_reviews.text: These look nice, are comfortable to wear and transmit power to the pedals efficiently. A good pair of cycling shoes for the money. I have only two small criticisms: First, I find the straps a little difficult to get completely tight. Second, these didn't come with cleats. I know, they don't promise that, but my last pair of Fizik shoes did come with cleats and I was hoping it would happen again.
customer_reviews.author: Steven A Seebart

customer_reviews.title: Nice value comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: Nice comfortable shoe. Stiff sole for not being carbon. Nice BOA closure. Fits snug but not tight. Don't know how they'll perform in the AZ heat. During my first long ride in these shoes, one of the cleat screws came off and the cleat was sliding left and right. Luckily another rider had a spare screw he gave me. I bought some Locktite today and will use it on l the cleat screws, tightening them to proper torque. Otherwise, I really like the fit and the stiffness of this shoe. The pink highlights compliment my pink socks and pink kit well.
customer_reviews.author: Bike Giant

customer_reviews.title: Good looking shoe, but the tongue is really annoying
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are overall great. Good looking, decent materials, pretty lightweight. There are few flaws, though. The first one is that you can't really make the front part any tighter: the front strap is not big enough and the BOA will only tight on your bridge. The second flaw is the tongue, it won't stay fixed in place, and slide to the side after 30-40 miles on the bike. I've had better shoes in the past that didn't need adjustment during rides.
customer_reviews.author: Giulio

customer_reviews.title: Very good but not perfect..at least for me
customer_reviews.text: I like this shoes. They are my first bike pair and so I might not be the best person to review the item. I would like to share my experience. The front part of the shoe seems a little to large compared to the rest of the shoe. The front stato does not really do much for you if you want to try to make fit snugger. The result is that after about 2-3 hours of ridding my toes start to feel numb. I thought that maybe I had chosen the wrong number but a small pair would not have fit.
customer_reviews.author: CRE

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoe for the sub $70 unpaid
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good shoe, but for deal I got on it it is an excellent shoe. These are more stuff than the best comparable alternative the shimano sh-rp5. Both have the carbon/nylon mix sole but the fizik is more stiff. I have the power strap version which I do t really care for, ideally wish I was able to get this color way with a boa closure. Anyone with a narrow foot like myself will not get a snug fit unless you have the straps totally hanging off the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Tamudawson

customer_reviews.title: Great sl shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I wore out some pearl izumi’s and always looking for a great amazon warehouse deal, found these in the right size. I experience less toe numbness with these than ever before, are breathable, stiff and overall feel great to ride in.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Stiff, Lite shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Very stiff shoe with no padding - which is good but it took getting used to. The BOA closure is excellellent, I'll never buy anything else after using these shoes. They go on/off easily and tighten securely small increments. Easy to adjust while riding without stopping. The black version is all black - kind of a unique look. I have about 1000 miles on my pair and they are holding up well. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Tbork123

customer_reviews.title: Size not accurate!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 40.5, which was supposed to be US size 8 and it was 2 or 3 sizes too small. I couldn't even put my foot in. It looks nice but I can't use it. I measured it with my other size 8 shoe and it was about 3 inches smaller. My wife is size 6 and a half women and the shoe fits her perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: Received scuffed/used shoes
customer_reviews.text: Did like the shoes, but didn't like paying new for shoes that had been used and returned. One shoe had scuffs on shoe itself and the side heel was scratched up. From the dirt on the bottom and in one of the tightners is was obvious someone returned used.
customer_reviews.author: K.L.F.

customer_reviews.title: A bit uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: They're good quality, but uncomfortable for me. The BOA dial puts quite a bit of pressure on the top of your foot, which becomes irritating after +/-20 miles. I've tried a size up and a size down, the shoe doesn't seem to fit snugly unless I crank the closures, causing pain. I went back to my Giro shoes quickly. Right now, I just keep them for winter shoes when I can double up on socks. Disappointing I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: defect
customer_reviews.text: The shoes fit true to size. However when attaching the cleats one of the screws would not tighten. The threads were stripped. A problem another purchaser apparently had with his or her purchase.
customer_reviews.author: HMJ

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I have been cycling for over 20 years now and this pair are the best I’ve owned. If you use a classical speedplay X series pedals, I highly recommend you upgrade your speedplay cleats with the new V2 version. Else the cleats will not sit flush against the sole of your Fizik shoes. Other than that this shoes are sexy. Very easy get into and out, and simple to adjust. Sole is plenty stiff. And did I mention there sexy.
customer_reviews.author: TaylorVersace

customer_reviews.title: Good, but narrow toe box.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these to use with my Peloton bike. They are lightweight and generally comfortable. However, for me, I have found them a bit constricting in the toe box. Ultimately, I switched back to a pair of the standard Peloton brand shoes, which work better for me. I'll keep these as a spare, and they might work better as road shoes for outdoor cycling.
customer_reviews.author: Barry S. Graubart

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I am loving these! I really like the clean looking design. The red heel and toe pads on the underside really help keep me from sliding around when duck walking across smooth surfaces. I have narrower feet, so it is usually tough for me to find shoes that fit perfect... these do (without breaking the bank). I measured my foot length in cm and looked up the correct size directly on the Fizik website.
customer_reviews.author: c.love

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I’ll admit that I do not know much about cycling shoes, but I purchased these for Spin Class and they were quite possibly the most uncomfortable shoes I’ve ever worn. There is zero padding in the shoes, so when you lift up off the saddle you are putting your full weight on your toes and it was unbearable. I will be returning these immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher R. Houston

customer_reviews.title: I am happy I bought these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes to ride my Peloton bike. Sizing is correct, and I particularly like the shoe laces which can be very easily and accurately adjusted, or loosened when I need to take off the shoes. They are comfortable to wear too. Overall I am glad I bought them, instead of going with the bundled shoes from Peloton.
customer_reviews.author: Hao L.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are my first biking shoes and I am very happy with them. Sturdy construction with high quality materials. The sole is nice and firm. Boa works great and is very convenient - highly recommend going that route. If I had a nit I would say the toe box is a little tall and the velcro above it doesn't really do anything because the materials are so firm. But that is a very minor complaint. I have >150 miles in them and they feel great. For sizing: I am 8.5-9 men's depending on the brand with a "typical" width foot. I found the 41s to be too narrow in the toes but the 41.5 is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: B. Myerholtz

customer_reviews.title: They work well with wide feet
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 8 wide in most shoes. Another review stated that these cycling shoes don't pinch his / her toes. I'm writing to confirm that statement. For reference, my foot is roughly 11 cm wide and I prefer Altras for running because of the wide toebox. I'm only just getting into cycling, so I don't feel I'm qualified to comment on anything other than fit. My longest ride in them has been 2 hours and they were comfortable, even in thick-ish cotton socks. They'd likely feel even better if I wore "performance" (read: thinner) socks with them.
customer_reviews.author: Matt H

customer_reviews.title: Was very excited with the initial feeling, but stitching and build quality isnt sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I tried these shoes on and was very excited about using them in my spin class. I finally got the cleats installed and I had my first session after COVID quarantine, but after just one class I found that the stitching on the side that seems to offer support for the main band of the shoe broke in a few different spots! It is quite disappointing, and since I have had these shoes for a while I cannot return them. Let's see how long they last, but its quite disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: mlock23

customer_reviews.title: Fiziks always fit me better than other bike shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have normal size feet. not chubby, not flat footed.. Fiziks always fit like they were made for me. For me they are way more comfortable than other brands I have had. They look cool too.. these two straps are plenty for me.. I'm not climbing hills in races .. I've never pulled out of a shoe ever.. plenty stiff.. love them.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight504

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for. It's a good training shoes, bit I would not use it for racing.
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that the shoes is relatively light. I am insane about having the boa system on all my riding shoes because the shoe just seems to feel more secure onmy foot as well as easy adjustments to the fly. However this is not one of their high end models so don't expect that when riding with the shoe. There is not much padding on the inside and the shoe does fell a bit plastic. But hell, it is still a great trainer at an awesome price.
customer_reviews.author: Steve C.

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe.
customer_reviews.text: The quality in the shoe is there but if you have a wider foot you may want to look at something else. I have somewhat of a fat foot so these are a very snug fit but still comfy enough to wear for long rides. My only gripe is that these shoes don't vent enough and have had many a sweaty sock after a ride.
customer_reviews.author: John L

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe. Looks great.
customer_reviews.text: I’m glad I made the investment in cycling shoes. I can feel the difference in my ride. It “seems” like I’m getting more power on each crank. I have no scientific proof but I’m enjoying my ride even more. The Boa lock deal is very convenient. Easy on and off. Never worried about a lace getting hung up.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Detroit

customer_reviews.title: Great road shoe
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable road shoe. Stiff carbon sole makes foot feel fine on long road rides without tiring. Boa closures makes shoes fit stable on foot during ride. European sizing makes using their sizing chart important before purchase. Be sure to use using chart to find size that best fits. Product delivered quickly.
customer_reviews.author: RE

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for the price, be wary of hot and sweaty climates
customer_reviews.text: Put about 300 miles in these shoes before leaving a review. For every ride under 45 miles they have been comfortable, easy to use and a great value. For rides up to 70 miles I began to get some soreness on the outside of my feet but the biggest issue was ventilation. I’ve never had cycling shoes retain sweat like these. All be it I’ve been biking in Okinawa summers but never had sweat pool like this. Otherwise great shoe and hope some breaking in will fix discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Ok Shoe.  Gets the job done.  Could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Overall, I’m happy but will not buy another cycling show with only one boa. With only one boa, I don’t feel the shoe gets tight around the base of my toes. I have another pair of cycling shoes with two boa type adjustments and they get tight all around.
customer_reviews.author: EG125

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for the money
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are a great value given the brand and worth the extra $40 or so over bargin brand shoes at $60. They are very light and stiff and the lace system works great for easy removal and tightening. I wear a 9.5 to 10 sport shoe US and got the 44, they fit perfect, very comfortable. Over all great deal at $115 US for a high quality cycle shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly T. Berger

customer_reviews.title: Great midrange cycling shoe
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this shoe. It feels stiff and the adjustability is incredible with the Boa dial. I wish the whole shoe was controlled by the dial, though. The Velcro strap doesn't seem to do much. Survived a crash as well and came away barely scratched.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: They fit  but not the right color
customer_reviews.text: They fit perfectly. The advertising picture shows a red shoe which I was hoping on. What I received was a orange pair of shoes. Very comfortable shoes. Get them.
customer_reviews.author: George J  Gilles

customer_reviews.title: Very supportive.
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are quite stiff to begin but they do gradually stretch out a bit! The clips I also ordered go on easily and clip into the pedals of the peloton bike easily . They’re very supportive and when I need them again I will definitely reorder these!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Great training shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is a very durable shoe that is great for Training. The color doesn’t show wear marks or scuffs, perfect for putting tons of miles to the pavement. Could be more comfortable but for the price and durability, it is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: MR

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, we'll priced. I've owned $400+ Sidi shoes, Giro shoes and I just got tired of spending so much money. These work just as will and I don't see any loss in my performance but I'm not racing in the Tour de France either. Great value and they shipped within one hour of ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Craven

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: I’m fairly new to road biking and how the shoes should fit, but these are my second pair of road bike shoes and I like the way they fit and the ease of adjustment. I would definitely by another pair if I needed to.
customer_reviews.author: cjofmd

customer_reviews.title: Real size and confort
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, I’m 8 in us size and I bought 39.5 it fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Segura

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I have no issues with these. They fit well and look good. The ratchet strapping works as it should and never comes loose when riding, cant ask for much more than that. They look like they will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Buytoomuch

customer_reviews.title: Crap construction
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Had for less than 10 rides/ 2 months and the straps already tearing.
customer_reviews.author: matt beals

customer_reviews.title: Spend more on better Fizik’s
customer_reviews.text: My second pair of Fizik’s. I have only used these 3 times as they are a bit heavy. i ride inside only. 6-7 days a week minimum 1 hr a day. I have the Aria 3 and I wish I had spent the extra money for a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: A great shoe for beginning clip in riders.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and attractive design. I would suggest buying a half size bigger for your pinky toes. A bit compacted in the front. Can feel a bit squeezed when climbing steep inclines. Overall very reliable and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Bahatimoe

customer_reviews.title: Go half is size smaller
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are very good I buy the shoes used like new for 85 dollars sold by Amazon warehouse and they shoes where new I did now find any sign s of wear that way you can save money they are very good worth the money I am a size 9 and I ordered a size 42 wihc it feel good but I have one inch of room in the front I will go half is size smaller
customer_reviews.author: Abraham Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: The Italian’s designed these super hot.
customer_reviews.text: The design is so hot, tried them on and very comfortable, there are no signs of poor quality. Fizik does nice work have their saddles too. I will update once I ride. Ok it’s a month or so later and no complaints. I probably could have ordered slightly smaller but I like to keep my toes moving anyway. Super comfortable on 60 mile ride and several shorter too. Cleanup is easy too.
customer_reviews.author: ES

customer_reviews.title: Cycling away!
customer_reviews.text: Love!!! I have a Peloton and I ride everyday. So comfort of shoes is exceptionally important to me. These are a fantastic fit. Love everything about them. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: VanMaxLuna

customer_reviews.title: Fizik too big
customer_reviews.text: These are very large fit compared to previous fizik. My other fizik shoes the stitched seams came apart after only 500 miles of riding. Made in China, cost is premium, I dont trusts the stitching.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin D

customer_reviews.title: Great cycling shoe for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: Great cycling shoe for a beginner. Hard to find now... get yours while you can.
customer_reviews.author: johndawg

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for great looks and function
customer_reviews.text: The obvious: they look damn good and get great compliments on them. Look good feel good ride good. Technical: the shoes fit true to size. So far they feel very stiff which is meant in a positive sense. Still getting used to the boa system but liking it as they are very quick and easy to adjust during rides. The low ankle cut also gives a nice open speed feeling
customer_reviews.author: jesse murillo

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoe for an awesome price. The only reason to spend more money is to get a double BOA closure which permits a slightly more customizable fit
customer_reviews.author: Kelli A Glover

customer_reviews.title: 43.5 perfect fit for US 10 1/2, medium wide foot
customer_reviews.text: Fit could not be much better. My right big toe just grazes the front of the shoe. My left big toes doesn't. Slightly different sized feet. I don't know why this and other bike shoes have rigid toes (almost like a steel toed boot). The toe is not where forward pressure is applied. I have actually cut a hole in the front of a bike shoe before. Fortunately, this 10 1/4 just fits lengthwise. Plenty of room width-wise. I would say shoe might get sloppy on a real narrow foot.
customer_reviews.author: dragon force

customer_reviews.title: Dual BOA dials ideal for my high arches.
customer_reviews.text: I have high arches. The dual BOA dials ideal as I can independently adjust for my high arches and toes pace. I wear a US 10-1/2, and the 44 are a good fit.
customer_reviews.author: JohnAMR

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, but runs big
customer_reviews.text: Received the shows and they look amazing. Shoe runs a little big and therefore my feet move and have blistered. Going to try thicker socks.
customer_reviews.author: Dunndeal4u

customer_reviews.title: swift
customer_reviews.text: great shoe comfortable but still stiff sole for support. This was a " Used " purchase was pleasantly surprised shoe looked brand new
customer_reviews.author: JESSE L ROBINSON DMD

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are pretty light and good looking. I have put about 800 miles on them and still feel like new.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Jesus Faneite

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought these back in September but just getting around to trying them out on my bike. They fit great and I was excited to use them. Tried to add cleats today and on one shoe the front screw won't go in as the inside is stripped.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley C Gaida

customer_reviews.title: Initially they felt comfortable, but rode with them on an indoor trainer ...
customer_reviews.text: Initially they felt comfortable, but rode with them on an indoor trainer 5 hours and hated them. I don't have historically wide or sensitive feet but the 47 seem to feel narrow and press the whole front of my foot. I'm a 13 US. Not sure if Fizik isn't my shoe or what I have an older pair of Specialized S works that I also don't like which prompted me to try these. Any suggestions would be great!
customer_reviews.author: cramieal

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike shoes
customer_reviews.text: Really like these cleats. Stuff and form fitting. Works with my Look Keo cleats and the size 46 fit my size 12 feet well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Maiman

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoes size is right on. Really like the boa fasteners. Feels like I am getting more power to the pedals with these shoes. Seller was quick to respond to my query about the shipment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking shoes
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable shoes up until the 45 min mark. The front of my foot goes to sleep. I think i need insoles. But great shoes
customer_reviews.author: C. Lambert

customer_reviews.title: A little hard on the first rides
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoes a couple weeks ago, the fit is right, with the centimeters of my feet’s I was right on the spot, but somehow at the beginning I was feeling both a little to harsh and tight on some spots, after a couple of uses they have been getting softer, still in the proces they are getting better
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wide toebox
customer_reviews.text: As pictured, nice and wide toebox, I primarily wear New Balance and Brooks for running sneakers, the overall shape is similar here.
customer_reviews.author: William J.

customer_reviews.title: Ok shoes for price but rather go for the full boa
customer_reviews.text: The materiel keeps stretching and the front velcro fails to do its job. The design of the boa cables holding 60% of the upper section rather than the lower 60%, makes the shoe quite unsecure. My feet kept moving around 30mins in to the ride.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great value in a road shoe. Stiff, not too uncomfortable, superior closures, and excellent aesthetics.
customer_reviews.author: pahouseholder

customer_reviews.title: Not SPD cleats compatible!! Yet excellent shoes!
customer_reviews.text: FYI this cycling shoes is not SPD compatible (at least this model). I have contacted the seller for an exchange and I will update my review once I receive their response. Other than that it is an excellent product. Durability, comfortable and fits to size.
customer_reviews.author: PM

customer_reviews.title: Decent buy. Wish a could have tried them on first.
customer_reviews.text: It is a very light shoe. Looks great. But the downside is you don’t have very much padding inside which makes for a rigid feel sometimes. They are usable for sure, but I wouldn’t buy without trying them on, again.
customer_reviews.author: H Loz

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Just got these, they feel amazing so far and fit perfect. Ordered a 42, my foot sizes are 10.25in(L), 10in(R), normal us sizes are usually a 9-9.5-10 depending on brand.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is my first bike shoes ever and I love it.. i really like the BOA system it make things way easier especially if you have a wide foot. I went for the white colour as it fits most my cycling jerseys.. but if i can go back in time I would have ordered a black one or a darker colour as the white one gets ditry fairy quickly no matter what you do.
customer_reviews.author: Ismail A.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first foray into clipless pedals and shoes. Seem to be quite good. Light weight and look good. Straps are easy to pull plenty tight. Cleats are easy to attach, as well. They do scuff easy. I dropped them on accident and that was enough to scuff them. That being said, the best way to avoid wear on anything is to not use it, and they’ll definitely be getting used so I’m not too fussed at that!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Dauss

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, look nice, and fit great ! Need to break in though !
customer_reviews.text: Very good shoes for the money , fit my KEO Cleats nicely . The Boa system is awesome and tightens evenly all across your foot. Good bang for your buck . Only downfall is that they do get uncomfortable after long rides , this could possibly be because I have not broken them in completely yet since i’ve Only used them a handful of times . But overall , so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Sandi. B

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done. Not super comfortable or anything, but similar to other shoes I’ve owned. I had to walk 2.5 miles in them the other day, and they held up. Velcro straps are nice.
customer_reviews.author: PM1620

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Love Fizik shoes. Bought these to replace some 3 year old R5Bs. The Coral is a little more to the pink side than the pictures should, but I like the boldness of the color. The sole is quite a bit more stiff than my old R5Bs.
customer_reviews.author: DR Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe but cheap coating
customer_reviews.text: These shoes get the job done, but beware. If anything brushes the outsoles, the color will come off extremely quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight Temple

customer_reviews.title: High End for High Price
customer_reviews.text: A little pricey side compared to my $60 pair, you can feel the difference in material quality, how sturdy it feels etc. If you want a pay for an extra fifty bucks for something that looks sleek and feels premium, go for it
customer_reviews.author: Ben Sackman

customer_reviews.title: Good value road shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I've ridden about 200 miles with these shoes so far. The Boa closure provides good tension adjustment. The Velcro strap across the top box is fairly useless as there is no way for it to tighten without folding the shoe. I have a little more width than I need in the toe area but have a fairly narrow foot. Overall has been a great shoe for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Dukek

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes for me!
customer_reviews.text: I tried the tightening down laces, which didn't hold. these fit perfectly do not move. I just hope they last a long time!
customer_reviews.author: WILL

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: They are awesome. My foot is wide and thick, sad I had to let them go :(
customer_reviews.author: HE

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade to SPD-SL
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from Shimano mountain biking shoes. I wore size 46 for Shimano but found 45.5 for Fizik was better
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: These fit perfect in size 42
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd pair I’ve owned. Not many manufacturers offer half sizes for cycling shoes. I wear a size 9 in regular men’s walking/dress/running shoes but size 9 or 42 is too small in cycling shoes. Size 10 in cycling shoes is too big. These fit perfect in size 42.5 and the quality an looks are top notch. Can’t go wrong with Fizik.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto C.

customer_reviews.title: Endless comfort!
customer_reviews.text: I got Fizik R5 Road Cycling Shoe instead of the NW I used for years. Fizik R5 shoes are way more comfortable and lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Xred90

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good biking shoes. No complaints. It does run smaller than size.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Time to ride!
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe for road biking. Light, comfortable and cool lace strapping!
customer_reviews.author: SonAmazon

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are awesome. I wear a US 10
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are awesome. I wear a US 10.5 and I ordered one full size "11.5" and they fits very comfortable. the shoes accommodated my wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M.

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre at best
customer_reviews.text: Velcro doesn’t stay connected while riding. It gets very annoying. Just buy the Peloton shoes and stop searching for something better. It doesn’t exist.
customer_reviews.author: David Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: bad screw thread
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the shoes took forever to be shipped. When, it finally arrived, it was defective. The front screw on one of the shoes would not tighten. I tried different combinations of screws and cleats to make sure the problem is in the shoe itself. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Shabara

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Tried these on at the store & bought them online. Good shoes. White version shows dirt after a few uses, but they still look fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew De Silva

customer_reviews.title: Narrow.
customer_reviews.text: Laughably barrow. I’ve never had an issue with my feet being to wife ever.
customer_reviews.author: CSG

customer_reviews.title: Very good shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes to ride in just did a 100 mile ride with them and no pain
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: False advertisements
customer_reviews.text: The size is too small, and the seller advertised free return actually, that is misleading they do charge $7.50. I was thinking to reorder bigger size but now I changed my mind.
customer_reviews.author: Sebhat Gezehey

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: After about a month of riding, the upper material has started to separate from the sole of the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Great quality! Easy of use!
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of riding shoes! They are Top of the line! Quick to put on and take off, comfortable and great quality!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: value shoe
customer_reviews.text: Fizik makes a sleek shoefor a gogd price. I like tge narrow profile and width as it fits my foot better.
customer_reviews.author: Mark E. Albrecht

customer_reviews.title: Dont hesitate
customer_reviews.text: Fit a little snug in the toe box but besides that they fit great, I love the boa the construction is very good, super stiff. I'd love for them to be a little bit lighter and a little more ventilated. Great first road shoe if your interested
customer_reviews.author: Wyatt w salas

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: These shoes ship from S. Korea. If they don't work out, shipping charges to return will be more than the actual cost of the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Lori V. Traudt

customer_reviews.title: Great looking and fitting show
customer_reviews.text: Great road shoes Fit about a half size large Can get them nice and tight with the Velcro
customer_reviews.author: Jason Didday

customer_reviews.title: The correct size
customer_reviews.text: The only problem is even when I purchase one size bigger than my normal size still is a little small.
customer_reviews.author: Galo Davalos

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes, still have to break them in a bit but god how they change the cycling game. One aspect I didn’t realize they had was a bit of rubber traction on the inside which really helps with the stability of the shoe when sprinting or riding uphill.
customer_reviews.author: malik renner

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes and price. Just wish they weren't kangaroo. But nice shoes
customer_reviews.author: Blondefly

product_meta.title: Fizik Tempo Overcurve R5 Racing Bike Shoes Black/Black Shoe Size EU 39 2020 Cycling Shoes
product_meta.description:
Tempo Overcurve R5 is a quick-fit road cycling shoe designed to suit every rider and every ride. With a timeless look and verstaile performance the classic road shoe has been redefined with a distinct fi'zi:k identity and a smart form-fitting construction.
The shoe features a staggered collar that wraps around the ankle tracking the natural misalignment of the ankle's two boney protusions; the lateral and medial malleoli. The result is an asymetric shape, with the throat of the shoe curving over the foot from the outside to the inner side.
The closure is fast and easily micro adjustable using a BOA IP1 dial and velcro strap to fine tune the fit in the forefoot area.
Specifications
Outsole - R5 carbon reinforced nylonBOA IP1-B dialApproximate weight - 253g (size 42 1/2 pair)Sizes - 36-48
